headers.subject: Re: [griffon-dev] Griffon 0.1.1 release

body.para: Found another hiccup calling 'griffon upgrade' on a plugin project (after installing 01x-17)
[aalmiray@localhost trunk]$ griffon upgrade Welcome to Griffon 0.1.1 - http://griffon.codehaus.org/ Licensed under Apache Standard License 2.0 Griffon home is set to: /usr/local/griffon

Base Directory: /usr/dev/ codehaus.org/griffon/plugins/griffon-jide-builder/trunk Running script /usr/local/griffon/scripts/Upgrade.groovy Environment set to development [mkdir] Created dir: /usr/dev/ codehaus.org/griffon/plugins/griffon-jide-builder/trunk/test [mkdir] Created dir: /usr/dev/ codehaus.org/griffon/plugins/griffon-jide-builder/trunk/test/integration [mkdir] Created dir: /usr/dev/ codehaus.org/griffon/plugins/griffon-jide-builder/trunk/test/unit Found application events script NOTE: Your application currently expects griffon version [0.1.0], this target will upgrade it to Griffon 0.1.1 ... [delete] Deleting directory /home/aalmiray/.griffon/0.1.1/projects/trunk/resources Error executing script Upgrade: No signature of method: org.apache.tools.ant.Project.replaceProperties() is applicable for argument types: (groovy.util.ConfigObject) values: [[:]] gant.TargetExecutionException: No signature of method: org.apache.tools.ant.Project.replaceProperties() is applicable for argument types: (groovy.util.ConfigObject) values: [[:]] at gant.Gant$_dispatch_closure4.doCall(Gant.groovy:313) at gant.Gant.dispatch(Gant.groovy:316) at gant.Gant.this$2$dispatch(Gant.groovy) at gant.Gant.invokeMethod(Gant.groovy) at gant.Gant.processTargets(Gant.groovy:446) at gant.Gant.processTargets(Gant.groovy:430) Caused by: groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method: org.apache.tools.ant.Project.replaceProperties() is applicable for argument types: (groovy.util.ConfigObject) values: [[:]] at _GriffonClean_groovy$_run_closure3.doCall(_GriffonClean_groovy:51) at _GriffonClean_groovy$_run_closure3.doCall(_GriffonClean_groovy) at _GriffonClean_groovy$_run_closure2.doCall(_GriffonClean_groovy:34) at _GriffonClean_groovy$_run_closure2.doCall(_GriffonClean_groovy) at Upgrade$_run_closure1.doCall(Upgrade:69) at Upgrade$_run_closure1.doCall(Upgrade) at gant.Gant$_dispatch_closure4.doCall(Gant.groovy:306) ... 5 more
On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 7:04 PM, Danno Ferrin <danno.ferrin@shemnon.com>wrote:

quote.quotepara: hmm... looks like we need to rethink build.properties then in 0.2, so we can override on the command line and get the same value in the build.
bumped the source files, then did a re-spin.
On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 7:35 PM, Andres Almiray <aalmiray@gmail.com>wrote:
got this after running the installer obtained from bamboo
[aalmiray@localhost SwingPad]$ griffon run-app Welcome to Griffon 0.1.1-SNAPSHOT - http://griffon.codehaus.org/ Licensed under Apache Standard License 2.0 Griffon home is set to: /usr/local/griffon

Base Directory: /tmp/SwingPad Running script /usr/local/griffon/scripts/RunApp.groovy Environment set to development Warning, target causing name overwriting of name default Found application events script Application expects griffon version [0.1.1], but GRIFFON_HOME is version [0.1.1-SNAPSHOT] - use the correct Griffon version or run 'griffon upgrade' if this Griffon version is newer than the version your application expects.
looks like the -SNAPSHOT tag is still around
On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 3:34 PM, Danno Ferrin <danno.ferrin@shemnon.com>wrote:
That's the point of the timing of this release ;)
On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 4:23 PM, Guillaume Laforge <glaforge@gmail.com>wrote:
Jim could even announce the release during his talk at GR8Conf ;-)
On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 00:22, Andres Almiray <aalmiray@gmail.com>wrote:
great! artifacts are ready, will take them for a spin after work.
On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 3:18 PM, Danno Ferrin < danno.ferrin@shemnon.com> wrote:
Ok, I think I've come to a conclusion. 0.1.1 will go out ASAP. It may be the last release, 0.1.2 will only happen if notable bugs are found.
When addons work after some fashion 0.2 beta will ship (hopefully before the JavaOne BOF).
(I've got some work and family stuff going on, otherwise this wold have gone out saturday).

So, with that being said, I spun off bamboo. Would this release ( http://bamboo.ci.codehaus.org/browse/GRIFFON-RELEASE01X-16 ) pass muster? Caution, I haven't even had a chance to look at these freshly spun bits, so it's not a loaded question. Once the kiddos are in bead I'll do some vetting and such.
-- Guillaume Laforge Groovy Project Manager Head of Groovy Development at SpringSource http://www.springsource.com/g2one
Attend the GR8 Conference, a conference dedicated to Groovy, Grails and Griffon http://www.gr8conf.org
Read the blog: http://www.gr8conf.org/blog/list Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/gr8conf

------------------------------------------- http://jroller.com/aalmiray http://www.linkedin/in/aalmiray -- What goes up, must come down. Ask any system administrator. There are 10 types of people in the world: Those who understand binary, and those who don't. To understand recursion, we must first understand recursion.

body.footer: -- What goes up, must come down. Ask any system administrator. There are 10 types of people in the world: Those who understand binary, and those who don't. To understand recursion, we must first understand recursion.
